Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for private connectivity, including bandwidth, latency, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Private Link.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of Private Link endpoints, integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks, and security considerations.
Ensure all necessary authorizations and approvals are obtained, including compliance with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Set up the Private Link service in Azure, specifying the resource to be accessed privately and configuring the necessary settings.
Create and configure Private Endpoints for the required Azure resources. Ensure proper DNS resolution and routing.
Apply security best practices, such as Network Security Groups (NSGs), Azure Firewall, and access control policies to secure Private Link connections.
Perform thorough testing of the Private Link connectivity, including DNS resolution, latency measurements, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for endpoint status and performance metrics.
Document the network architecture, Private Link configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant teams.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
